title: Does spousal support take precedence over tax debt?
question: As my ex-husband and I go broke, we owe the IRS a large amount of money. Will the IRS adjust his tax burden so that he can continue to support me? We were married 25 years, and I have no other income or skills.
answers: Both are non-discharge debts that have to be paid. It would be appropriate for you to seek the assistance of a tax attorney in order to discuss whether or not one will take precedence over the other. Remember however, there are competing interests going after his wages. Usually, there will be some sort of compromise.

The answer to your question is, in general, "yes." The IRS is going to allow him enough income to pay the amount of court-ordered support unless the amount is clearly ridiculous, in which case the IRS might wonder whether someone is trying to play games.
Generally speaking, the IRS will take into account reasonable support in determining what your ex-husband can be expected to pay toward the unpaid taxes each month.
